image.alt: Christensen Orthodontics team smiling with patients

Home.title: Your Path To A Beautiful Smile

paragraphs.text: A beautiful smile is within reach, and with our orthodontic treatments, achieving it has never been easier. We guide you through every step, from your first consultation to the day you see your transformed smile.
Our team creates treatment plans that fit your lifestyle and goals, delivering personalized care with clear communication and a focus on comfort for patients of all ages.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: We use 3D intraoral scanning and digital imaging for faster, more accurate treatment planning.

items.title: Experienced Specialist Care
items.text: Dr. Todd Christensen is a board-trained orthodontic specialist with more than a decade of clinical experience.

items.title: Flexible & Affordable
items.text: We accept many PPO plans, offer in-office financing, and run special offers to help make treatment affordable.

items.title: Family-Friendly Care
items.text: We tailor plans for children, teens, and adults, focusing on comfort, clear communication, and lasting results.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Todd Christensen, DMD, MS, is an orthodontic specialist with over 13 years of clinical experience. He completed a Master of Science in Dental Medicine and his orthodontic residency at the University of Colorado, and he is an active member of professional organizations. Dr. Christensen combines specialist training with a patient-centered approach to deliver care for children, teens, and adults.
We offer discreet clear aligners, modern braces, retainers, and pediatric phase-one treatment to meet every smile need.

image.alt: Clear aligners for discreet orthodontic treatment

image.alt: Christensen Orthodontics team photo in the South Jordan office

paragraphs.text: We want you to feel like you can trust us with your smile. We provide high-quality orthodontic care using advanced technology and a compassionate, personalized approach, making every visit comfortable, informative, and tailored to each patient’s needs.
Our team works closely with you and your family to create a treatment plan that fits your lifestyle and long-term oral health goals.

Todd Christensen, DMD, MS is the founder and orthodontic specialist at Christensen Orthodontics in South Jordan. He brings more than a decade of orthodontic experience and a patient-centered approach to care, helping children, teens, and adults achieve healthy, confident smiles.

image.alt: Dr. Todd Christensen smiling in his office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christensen graduated from Highland High School in Salt Lake City, played college basketball at BYU while earning a B.S. in Biology, completed his D.D.S., magna cum laude, at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, finished a one-year General Practice Residency at the University of Utah Hospital, and earned a Master of Science in Dental Medicine while completing his orthodontic residency at the University of Colorado.

Dr. Christensen is a board-trained orthodontic specialist and the author of peer-reviewed articles on enamel preservation and oral cancer etiology. He is an active member of the American Association of Orthodontists and the American Dental Association.

Dr. Christensen treats patients of all ages with comprehensive orthodontics, including braces, clear aligners, Damon® systems, and fully digital workflows that use 3D scanning and digital X-rays to plan efficient, comfortable treatment.
A husband and father of four who lives in the South Jordan community, Dr. Christensen enjoys golf, coaching youth basketball, and playing guitar. He is active locally and fluent in Spanish.

slides.alt: Team and waiting area at Christensen Orthodontics
3D intraoral scanner used for digital impressions
Digital X-ray and imaging equipment in the operatory
Clinical in-chair photo showing braces treatment

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christensen and our team are active members of the South Jordan community. Dr. Christensen coaches youth basketball and participates in local events, and our practice focuses on family-centered care and building lasting relationships with patients and neighborhood families.

image.alt: Christensen Orthodontics team participating in community activities

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit begins with a consultation with Dr. Todd Christensen. He will perform a clinical exam, review your dental and medical history, and talk through your goals so we can recommend the best treatment plan.
We use digital imaging, including 3D scans and digital X-rays, to create an accurate plan. Please bring any completed patient forms to help us get you started more quickly.

image.alt: Digital X-rays and imaging in an orthodontic office

Get Started.title: Payment options, financing, and special offers

paragraphs.text: We offer flexible payment options and will review financing during your consultation. Learn more about our financial options: https://www.christensenorthoslc.com/patient-resources/financial-options/
If you have questions about costs or insurance, call our office at 801-446-5548 (tel:801-446-5548) and our treatment coordinator will help you find the right plan.

Please complete the new patient paperwork before your visit: https://www.christensenorthoslc.com/patient-resources/patient-forms/. Online patient forms are coming soon; call 801-446-5548 if you need assistance.

image.alt: Christensen Orthodontics team photo welcoming new patients

og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey with Dr. Todd Christensen. Learn what to expect on your first visit, access patient forms, and schedule a free consultation in S.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a reliable option for correcting a wide range of alignment and bite issues. They use brackets and wires to move teeth predictably and can be customized to meet each patient’s needs.
Dr. Todd Christensen provides comprehensive care and monitoring throughout treatment, helping patients — teens and adults alike — achieve a healthy, long-lasting result.

image.alt: a woman with braces on her teeth

paragraphs.text: Damon® braces use a self-ligating system that lets wires move with less friction, often reducing adjustment visits and improving comfort. They can be a great choice for patients seeking efficient, effective treatment.
Our team will evaluate whether Damon® braces are right for you and tailor a treatment plan that balances speed, comfort and results.
We offer Spark™ and 3M™ Clarity™ clear aligner systems for patients who want a discreet, removable option. These aligners are virtually invisible and easy to remove for eating and oral hygiene.
Both systems are custom-made from advanced materials to provide comfortable, precise tooth movement as part of a personalized treatment plan.

image.alt: a woman smiles as she puts in a Clear Aligner

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> aligners offer a nearly invisible way to straighten teeth without metal brackets. They are custom-made for comfort and can be removed for meals and oral care.
Treatment is tailored to your needs using digital impressions and periodic check-ins to keep progress on track; many cases complete in roughly 12 to 18 months depending on complexity.

image.alt: a woman holding up a clear aligner in front of her face

paragraphs.text: Retainers help preserve your orthodontic results. We provide custom removable and fixed retainers, with guidance on proper wear and care to keep your smile stable for the long term.
Simple habits — daily cleaning, safe storage and follow-up visits — are all it takes to protect your investment in a lasting smile.

image.alt: a woman is smiling and holding a retainer in her hand

paragraphs.text: Adults benefit from discreet, effective orthodontic options that fit busy lives. We offer clear aligners and low-profile braces to address bite problems and improve oral health and confidence.
Your plan will consider cosmetic goals, timing, and any restorative or periodontal needs to create a treatment path that works for you.

image.alt: a smiling woman sitting in a blue chair

paragraphs.text: Teen treatment focuses on growth and development, using digital imaging and regular check-ins to guide progress. Options include traditional braces and clear aligners tailored to a teen’s lifestyle.
We prioritize comfort, predictable timing and collaboration with families to keep teens on track toward a confident, healthy smile.

image.alt: a young man with braces on his teeth

paragraphs.text: Phase one treatment guides jaw growth and creates space for permanent teeth when early intervention is appropriate. Treating select issues early can reduce the need for more invasive procedures later.
Dr. Christensen works closely with families to determine the right timing and appliance for each child’s development and long-term dental health.

image.alt: a young girl's mouth with a missing tooth

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about clear aligners, Damon® and traditional braces, treatment timelines, comfort, and how to schedule with Christensen Orthodontics in South Jordan, UT.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer traditional braces, Damon® self-ligating braces, and clear aligner options including Spark™ and 3M™ Clarity™ as well as Invisalign<sup>®</sup>. We also provide custom retainers to protect your finished smile.

accordion.header: How are clear aligners different from traditional braces?

paragraphs.text: Clear aligners are nearly invisible and removable, which makes eating and daily oral hygiene easier. Unlike braces, aligners fit over your teeth and are taken out for meals and brushing.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment times vary by the case. Clear aligner plans often range from six to 18 months, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> commonly takes 12 to 18 months, and traditional or Damon® brace treatments depend on complexity; we’ll give a personalized timeline at your first visit.

accordion.header: Are aligners or Damon braces comfortable?

paragraphs.text: Most patients find clear aligners comfortable, with only mild, temporary pressure when switching trays. Damon® braces use a self-ligating system that can reduce friction and the need for frequent adjustments, which many patients find more comfortable than traditional brackets and ties.

accordion.header: How do I schedule an appointment and where do you serve?

paragraphs.text: Call or text us at 801-446-5548 to request an appointment, or use our contact page to request a visit online. We treat patients in South Jordan and the surrounding communities across the Salt Lake Valley.
